commitResults.messageTitle: Add left padding to page nav title (#1625)
Fix intrasiteLinkValidation code block (#1527)
Fix missing return termination in rebuildRequiredPages (#1541)
Implement live preview for site.json (#1529)
commitResults.messageBody:
When attributes other than pages in site.json are modified, a server
restart is required to reflect the changes on the live preview. This 
can become a hassle to the user as they will need to frequently 
restart the server when trying out different site configuration.

Let's support live preview for all the attributes in site.json so 
that the latest changes can be reflected without restarting 
the server.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix reloading issue for custom site configs (#1579)
Fix unresponsive fixed header padding (#1595)
commitResults.messageBody:
When external stylesheets from different domains are used,
the cssRules of these stylesheets cannot be accessed or
modified due to CORS policy. This causes the method that
adjusts the fixed header padding to throw an error and
terminate prematurely.

Let's wrap this method in a try/catch block so that external
stylesheets from other domains will be skipped if cssRules
is not accessible.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix blocking ::before pseudo element in panel (#1603)
commitResults.messageBody:
Using ::before in panels may block interactive elements before
the panels. The spacing created using ::before is needed so that
panels do not get blocked by the fixed header when using anchor
navigation.

Let's replace ::before with scroll-margin-top which similarly creates
spacing before the panels when using anchor navigation and does
not block other elements.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix type warning for active prop in tab (#1613)
Bump package-lock.json
Update expected font-awesome test assets
Bump package-lock.json
Bump node version requirement to v12
Bump CI npm versions
Update more node and npm version requirements
Fix PlantUML typo in `diagrams.mbdf` of User Guide (#1600)
NodeProcessor refactor: split into separate files (#1515)
Ignore include tags during markdown processing (#1540)
commitResults.messageBody:
With the updated content processing flow of
nunjucks->markdown->html, the content in
includes tag are being processed on the
markdown side, causing display bugs when
using includes with nested variables.

Let's mark the include tag to be ignored 
during markdown processing

commitResults.messageTitle: Update highlightjs method call syntax (#1521)
commitResults.messageBody:
With highlightjs v10.7.0, the highlight API syntax has been 
modified. Specifically, the usage of continuation as an 
extra argument, which Markbind uses for line-by-line 
highlighting, has been deprecated.

Highlighting the entire code block first and adding 
the neccessary opening and closing tags for each 
line would enable line-by-line highlighting and also 
allow us to use the latest highlightjs API syntax.

Let's,
* update the highlight method to use the latest 
version's syntax
* update the logic for line-by-line highlighting to 
do highlighting of the entire code block first and do 
post-processing to add the neccessary opening 
and closing tags per line.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove FOUC temporary styles
Resolve Vue side effects
commitResults.messageBody:
Vue will raise warnings for the following:
- use of undefined variables in components
- use of un-provided injection variables
- compilation of unknown tags
- mutation of props

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement SSR for MarkBind
Remove HTML beautification feature
Resolve SSR hydration issues
Update CI platform for build rerun in PR merge guide (#1520)
Avoid mutating Vue components' props (#1551)
Bump eslint dependencies (#1552)
Standardise fsUtil import variable name (#1554)
Reorganize utility functions (#1555)
Fix specificity of panel pseudo class for fixed header (#1557)
Use portals for mobile site and page nav (#1556)
commitResults.messageBody:
With Vue SSR implemented, site and page nav mobile overlays are unable
to retrieve the original page source describing the respective
navigation components.
This results in being unable to mount an interactive copy of said
components.

Let's change the mobile site and page nav overlays to use portals as
the content source instead.
Portal sources (site / page nav) are identified and created during
build time.

commitResults.messageTitle: Hide mobile navigation menus if there are no links (#1561)
Forward root element styles to mobile navigation menu (#1562)
Fix page & site nav component paddings (#1564)
Change {{ pageNav }} variable to <page-nav> (#1572)
commitResults.messageBody:
Using a nunjucks variable for page navs with the new layout system is
inconsistent with the use of <site-nav /> as navigation components.

Let's standardise these syntaxes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Make the navbar current link highlight subtler (#1574)
Fix navbar dropdown text highlight text color (#1577)
Fix unique by logic for Externals (#1587)
Add missing site-nav tag to html special tags (#1622)
Lazy serve: fix untracked tab bug on backwards navigation (#1522)
Lazy serve: Fix improper handling of incomplete active urls (#1532)
Fix delay to return delayed function result for use (#1538)
Fix live-server to keep client on refreshcss (#1545)
Add background build option to one-page serve (#1539)
commitResults.messageBody:
Running markbind serve -o only builds pages as the user visits
those pages. As search data is populated according to built pages,
it is then limited to the pages that users have visited before,
rendering the search bar ineffective in live preview. Also, as
serve -o builds pages on-demand, the time between page builds is not
effectively utilized to build other pages.

Let's add an option to serve that can utilize the time after the
landing page has been generated to do a background build of pages that
are not yet built, updating the search data as it goes. Users thus get
not just the pages that they visited but also the pages that are built
in the background.

commitResults.messageTitle: Lazy-serve: Rebuild opened pages on add/remove page (#1550)
commitResults.messageBody:
With the addition of the multi-tab development flow, single-page serve
can keep track of all opened pages instead of a single currently
viewed page. This flow is already adopted in page edit events,
but it has yet to be adopted in page addition or removal.

Let's adopt the multi-tab development mechanism on the page addition' +
and removal flow.

commitResults.messageTitle: Handle baseUrl in live-preview reload check (#1594)
commitResults.messageBody:
In live-preview, checks are implemented to only reload pages that
correspond to the changed file. However, the comparison used for the
check has not taken into account the base url of the site, which
causes these checks to always fail and thus pages are not automatically
reloaded.

Let's add base url handling to the check, so that sites with specified
can properly benefit from the live-preview feature.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add hamburger animations to site/page nav icons (#1596)
Update docs to include double quotes for diagram example (#1624)
Change all $slots to $scopedSlots (#1535)
commitResults.messageBody:
With the update to the deprecated slot syntax in #1464, the $slots
syntax does not work as it used to anymore, possibly due to the
internal changes for slot syntax in Vue. To be specific, named slots
will always disappear from $slots upon re-rendering but will always
be present in $scopedSlots. This causes named slot content to
disappear from Vue components upon any re-rendering.

Let's change all $slots syntax to $scopedSlots to prevent slot contents
from disappearing.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix custom components markdown parsing (#1548)
commitResults.messageBody:
We have never defined the behavior of our custom components as html
tags (whether block-level or inline) in markdown parsing. 
This causes some undesirable edge cases during markdown parsing, as
raised up in #958.

Let's adopt the way VuePress define the behaviour for custom components
and adapt it to fit our needs.

commitResults.messageTitle: Instantiate server Vue instance with parameters (#1563)
Fix User Guide next/prev link for tweakingThePageStructure (#1568)
commitResults.messageBody:
The next link for usingHtmlJavaScriptCss is linking to
usingPlugins when it should be linking to tweakingThePageStructure
and the prev link for tweakingThePageStructure is linking to
usingPlugins when it should be linking to usingHtmlJavaScriptCss.

Let's fix the links for them accordingly.

commitResults.messageTitle: Hoist <script> and <style> tags to after <body> (#1565)
commitResults.messageBody:
Our setup compiles whatever is in the content section of the page into
Vue application. We also do server-side rendering on the content. Within
the content section, we allow users to write <script> and/or <style>
tags. However, during compilation, Vue will ignore and discard these tags.
Furthermore, during server-side rendering, special characters in
<script> tags will be escaped. While we have measures to tackle the
problems above, we should look to implement a better workaround.

Let's remove the temporary measures and prevent the compilation and
rendering of <script> and/or <style>, by hoisting them out of the
content section and to after <body> tag.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update Developer Guide on SSR (#1570)
commitResults.messageBody:
There are a few important information that contributors should
take note of regarding SSR (especially hydration issues).

Let's update the developer guide to include those information.

commitResults.messageTitle: Resolve SSR Hydration Issue for Disqus plugin (#1569)
commitResults.messageBody:
<disqus> HTML tag is an unknown element to Vue as it is neither
a registered Vue component nor an official HTML element. This causes
hydration issue in our SSR setup whenever the Disqus plugin is used.

Let's add v-pre to the <disqus> HTML tag so that Vue will ignore
the tag when compiling/rendering, thus resolving hydration issue.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update Developer Guide on SSR based on feedback (#1573)
Add appFactory methods to Vue for setup without search (#1592)
Add whitelist of tags for intra-site link validation (#1593)
commitResults.messageBody:
Intra-site link validation should not validate links that are needed
during build time (e.g. include/panel) as they have their own
validation logic already.

Let's implement a whitelist of tags that we should validate.

commitResults.messageTitle: Parse <md> tag in Markdown as inline (#1598)
